decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing mill cards and creatures to quickly deplete the opponent's library, while also disrupting their strategy with removal and counterspells. The goal is to mill out the opponent as fast as possible, using cards like Hedron Crab, Fractured Sanity, and Archive Trap to achieve victory through decking. The deck also includes disruption spells like Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch to control the board and protect the mill strategy. The combination of efficient mill cards and control elements makes this deck a powerful and versatile option in Modern 1 vs 1 gameplay.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Fallaji Archaeologist. By utilizing instant speed reanimation and protection spells like Ephemerate and Force of Negation, the deck aims to create explosive plays and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to respond. Additionally, the deck includes disruption and card selection tools like Thoughtseize and Faithful Mending to control the game and set up its combo pieces for a lethal finish.

This deck relies on utilizing lands and mana acceleration to quickly ramp into powerful threats like Primeval Titan. The key strategy involves using Amulet of Vigor to untap lands for multiple activations per turn, allowing for explosive plays and the ability to tutor for key pieces with cards like Summoner's Pact. The combination of lands like Urza's Saga and Lotus Field with land-based tutors like Tolaria West and Green Sun's Zenith enables the deck to consistently assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm opponents with big creatures and game-ending spells like Scapeshift.

The deck focuses on fast mana generation and spell combo chains with cards like Pyretic Ritual, Manamorphose, and Ral, Monsoon Mage to generate a large storm count. It also includes Past in Flames to help recur spells from the graveyard, allowing for extra value and additional chances to go off. The inclusion of cards like Strike It Rich and Wish provide additional ways to search for combo pieces, while cards like Ruby Medallion and Glimpse the Impossible help reduce the cost of spells and draw through the deck faster. The deck aims to quickly build a lethal storm count and finish the game with a Grapeshot or other combo finisher.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts, specifically creatures and equipment, to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga to quickly generate mana and tokens, along with cards like Engineered Explosives and Pithing Needle to control the board, the deck aims to set up a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent. Emry, Lurker of the Loch helps recur artifacts from the graveyard, ensuring a constant stream of threats. Overall, the deck aims to quickly build a dominating board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the Allosaurus Rider combo by using Summoner's Pact, Eldritch Evolution, and Neoform to tutor for the necessary pieces. It utilizes mana acceleration creatures like Disciple of Freyalise and Generous Ent to ramp into large threats like Griselbrand and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant. Consign to Memory provides answers for problematic cards, while Pact of Negation offers protection for the combo. The deck also includes Planar Genesis to generate a large board presence and close out the game quickly. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently assembling the combo pieces and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to quickly bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand or Atraxa, Grand Unifier. By efficiently cycling through the deck with cards like Faithful Mending and Thoughtseize, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude, the deck aims to create explosive plays and overwhelm the opponent with unexpected threats. The inclusion of cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Negation provide additional protection and disruption to further the combo potential of the deck.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The main goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while drawing cards and setting up a win condition. Cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils provide additional control elements, while Solitude and Path to Exile deal with threats on the board. The deck also has a toolbox aspect with cards like Prismatic Ending and Isochron Scepter to deal with a variety of threats. Overall, the strategy revolves around outlasting the opponent and establishing dominance in the late game.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by disrupting opponents' strategies with disruptive creatures like Quantum Riddler and Phelia, while also providing early game pressure with Ragavan. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending, and generate card advantage with cards like Consign to Memory and Ephemerate. The deck also relies on powerful finishers like Phlage and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to close out games quickly. Additionally, the deck includes some counterspells and versatile lands to further control the game.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruption spells. By using Eldrazi Temple and Cavern of Souls to ramp into big threats like Thought-Knot Seer and It That Heralds the End, this deck aims to apply pressure early and consistently. Cards like Kozilek's Command and Glaring Fleshraker provide removal and disruption, while Sowing Mycospawn and Devourer of Destiny help to generate advantage and maintain board presence. The deck has a strong aggro game plan with a focus on Eldrazi synergy and disruption.

The deck focuses on generating strong card advantage and mana acceleration to quickly cast spells that deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Pyretic Ritual, Manamorphose, and Ral, Monsoon Mage, the deck aims to build up a storm count and ultimately finish off the opponent with Grapeshot. The key strategy is to chain together various spells in a single turn to create a massive burst of damage that overwhelms the opponent before they can react effectively. The deck also includes tools like Wish and Past in Flames to provide versatility and recursion.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts and using them to generate mana and control the opponent's board. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive artifact creatures and disrupt their strategy with cards like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke. The deck aims to win quickly by deploying a wide array of artifact threats and controlling the board through removal and counter spells. With a combination of artifact creatures and disruptive spells, this deck seeks to put pressure on the opponent and secure victory through aggressive plays.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature plays, supported by burn spells and disruptive effects. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with early creature presence and direct damage, utilizing the synergy between cards like Goblin Bombardment and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Elegant Parlor adds disruption to disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck's mana base includes fetch lands to ensure color consistency and access to its powerful cards. Overall, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish games quickly.

The deck focuses on using Puresteel Paladin to cheat out equipment like Colossus Hammer and Leyline Axe. By tutoring for equipment with cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Steelshaper's Gift, the deck aims to assemble a lethal combo quickly. The inclusion of Urza's Saga provides additional ways to fetch for key pieces, while Arid Mesa and Sunbaked Canyon help fix mana. With fast mana generation from Mox Opal and efficient equipment, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful attacks and disrupt their game plan with cards like Esper Sentinel.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game and out-value the opponent. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Quantum Riddler to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage and eventually winning through these powerful threats.

This Death and Taxes deck focuses on using aggressive creatures to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Solitude. The deck also utilizes flicker effects like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to abuse powerful ETB abilities, creating strong board presence and tempo advantage. The deck aims to control the board while chipping away at the opponent's life total, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of creature beats and disruption.
